key_title: Key to the genera of Amaranthaceae

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Amaranthaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Walsh, N.G. (1996). Amaranthaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves opposite; flowers in compact heads or short spikes
Leaves alternate or ± rosetted at base; flowers in spikes, racemes or panicles, or solitary in axils
Flowers in terminal head or short spike, sessile between 2 leaves
Perianth with copious silky or woolly hairs; stamens connate; flowers bisexual
Perianth inconspicuous, glabrous or nearly so; stamens free or shortly united at base; flowers usually unisexual
Flowers solitary in axils of fleshy leaves; subshrubs of saltmarsh or samphire communities
Flowers in cymes in axillary clusters or aggregated into terminal and/or axillary spikes; leaves not fleshy
Bracts not noticeably swollen in fruit; stamens 5; seed flattened-ovoid to subreniform; near-coastal saltmarshes
Bracts swollen in fruit; stamens 2; seeds ellipsoid to pear-shaped; far north-west Victoria only
